thread.title: End of the world 2017: Annular solar eclipse sparks apocalypse frenzy | Daily Star
thread.title_full: End of the world 2017: Annular solar eclipse sparks apocalypse frenzy | Daily Star

author: Jess Bell
title: End of the world 2017: Annular solar eclipse sparks apocalypse frenzy | Daily Star
text:
GETTY FRENZY: Truthseekers claim the annular eclipse is a sign of the apocalypse 
Stargazers around the world were treated to a stunning view this morning as the first solar eclipse of the year arrived. 
The annular eclipse saw a sliver of the sun — or “ring of fire”— just visible around the moon. 
But truth seekers claim the spectacle is more than just an impressive sight, and is one of several events predicting the oncoming apocalypse. Is this the END of days? Monday, 9th January 2017 We live in turbulent times. Trump has the keys to nuclear weapons, and could end work to prevent climate change. Putin is looming in the East, the far-right are on the rise in Europe and Kim Jong-un is developing nuclear weapons of his own. Is this the END of days? 1 / 13 Getty Images Before his inauguration, Donald Trump asked a security expert three times during a briefing, why the US couldn't use nuclear weapons after he becomes president. “From all the signs, we can know that the second coming is 'at the door'” Truthseekers 
Naysayers at the website “Signs of The End of Times” say this year we are “living right in the end of times for this world as we know it”. 
Celestial events like eclipses, meteor showers and blood moons all point to the inevitable apocalypse, it is claimed. 
They say: “If you take into consideration all the signs, there is no mistaking that our generation is living in the last days, nearing the second coming of Jesus. 
“The signs are so strong now and the evidence is so clear that any person willing to end times accept the truth can see that the end of the world, as we know it, is near." Related Articles
